text: Have you designed your interface to be usable without sound?
Can your app be used comfortably on small, low-end devices?
Is there a clear, persistent visual indicator that messages are end-to-end encrypted?
Does your onboarding clearly communicate what metadata is collected?
Have you considered including users with low literacy in your testing?
Can users delete their data and messages quickly in an emergency?
Have you included a way to use the app with a keyboard only?
Can your app be navigated using a screen reader?
Does the app remain functional with poor or no network connection?
Is your UI visually accessible for users with colorblindness?
Have you tested your content with left-to-right and right-to-left languages?
Do you offer multiple ways to perform key actions (e.g., tap, voice, type)?
Are font sizes and line spacing adjustable for readability?
Does your app clearly state who built it and why?
Have you included members of your target communities in design decisions?
Is there a way to delay sending a message to obscure the user's real-time location?
Can users tag or categorize saved content in their own terms?
Are error messages easy to understand and helpful?
Is your visual layout clear even when zoomed in 200%?
Have you designed for people who may have only one hand free?
Can your app be used with voice control tools?
Do users have control over what is shared publicly?
Have you accounted for different cultural interpretations of color or iconography?
Does your design avoid unnecessarily gendered features or assumptions?
Can people use the app without creating an account?
Do your push notifications respect context and urgency?
Have you considered users experiencing stress or crisis when designing flow?
Can your app be paused and resumed later without losing progress?
Do you allow users to opt out of metrics and tracking?
Have you designed for use in bright sunlight and low-light environments?
Can someone without formal education easily understand the app’s purpose?
Does your content use plain language wherever possible?
Do your form fields offer autocomplete or formatting help?
Are you respecting user agency in how you handle defaults?
Have you tested performance on older OS versions?
Do your images include descriptive alt text?
Can users navigate using gestures or voice if they can't touch the screen?
Is your app functional without downloading extra components?
Do you include skip links or quick navigation for long content?
Can you operate the entire app with one finger?
Does your app support light and dark modes?
Have you offered content in multiple formats (text, audio, visual)?
Does the app support multiple languages?
Can users easily give feedback or request features?
Is your interface forgiving of mistakes (undo, edit, confirm)?
Have you avoided features that demand constant attention?
Does your interface respect neurodiverse sensory needs (e.g., motion, blinking)?
Can someone understand what the app does in under 30 seconds?
Are time-sensitive actions clearly marked with feedback?
Have you made it easy to stop using the app and delete all data?
